flawed_nl_solution:
Three years from now, Kate will be 29 years + 3 years = <<29+3=32>>32 years old.
So by that time, Tully will be 32 years x 2 = <<32*2=64>>64 years old.
This means, Tully is 64 years - 3 years = <<64-3=16>>16 years old now.
Therefore, Tully was 16 years - 1 year = 15 years old last year.
#### 15

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 61, not 16. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
